com.peterverzijl.softwaresystems.qwirkle

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.peterverzijl.softwaresystems.qwirkle.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Master class for the game, this handles the setting up and running of the game.
    Author:
    Peter Verzijl

      • setFirstPlayer

        public void setFirstPlayer(java.util.Map<Player,java.util.List<Node>> firstSet)
        Sets the first player and does the move that was worth the most points.
        Parameters:

      • startingPlayer

        public java.util.Map<Player,java.util.List<Node>> startingPlayer(java.util.Map<Player,java.util.List<Node>> aMapWithFirstMoves)
        Receives the first move of all the players and determine which player should start by calculation the scores of each move. The player with the highest scoring moves wins.
        Parameters:
        aMapWithFirstMoves - The map of players, and their respective first moves.
        Returns:
        map with the best move and the player that did the move

      • hasEnded

        public boolean hasEnded()
        If there are no more stones in the bag Loop through all players and their hand till it finds a valid move.
        Returns:
        True if a valid move is found or if there are stones in the bag of stones.

      • checkHand

        public boolean checkHand(Player player,
                         Block block)
        Checks if a similar block, exists in the hand of the player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to check for.
        block - The block to check.
        Returns:
        Weighter the given block also exists in the player's hand.

      • checkHand

        public boolean checkHand(java.util.List<Node> set)
        Checks if all the given blocks are in the hand of the player.
        Parameters:
        set - The set of blocks to check.
        Returns:
        Weighter all the blocks are in the hand of the player.

      • doMove

        public void doMove(java.util.List<Node> aPlayerMove)
            throws IllegalMoveException,
                   NotYourBlockException
        Checks if the list of blocks received are in the hand of the player. Checks if the player wants to trade checks with the board if the move is valid removes the blocks from the hand if the move is valid.
        Parameters:
        aPlayerMove - The move that the player wants to make.
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - If the move given does not comply with the game rules.
        NotYourBlockException - If the player tries to do a move with stones he/she Does not have in her/his hand.

      • getFrontier

        public java.util.List<Node> getFrontier()
        Returns the board frontier, aka all possible empty spaces where the player can place his/her blocks.
        Returns:
        A list of empty nodes where blocks can be place.

        Parameters:

      • tradeBlock

        public Block tradeBlock(Player player,
                        Block block)
                 throws NotYourTurnException,
                        NotYourBlockException
        Trades a block with the bag.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who does the trade.
        block - The block type the player wants to trade.
        Returns:
        The block that is the result of the trade.
        Throws:
        NotYourTurnException - Thrown if this function is called when the player is not the current player.
        NotYourBlockException - Thrown if you try to trade a block that is not yours.
